Detailed Description

OpenGl renderer class.

This class is the facade class that implements all the necessary functionalities of the OpenGl API into the game engine. It handles creating VAOs, VBOs and EBOs for model data as well as the 3D rendering and uniform calculations to be correctly rendered.

Author:
Cordell Smith
Version:
01
Date:
31/05/2018

Member Function Documentation

void OpenGl::Prepare ( Model *  model,
std::string  vertShader,
std::string  fragShader 
)

Prepare.

Takes model data, vertex shader string and fragment shader string and prepares the VAO, VBO and EBO attribute data. It stored the correct data in each attribute of the models VAO, VBO and EBO to be used in the rendering process later on.

Parameters:
Model* model
std::string vertShader
std::string fragShader
Returns:
void

void OpenGl::Render ( Model *  model  ) 

Render.

Takes model data that is parsed in as a parameter and accesses the necessary opneGl components to render the model to the screen. This includes the textures associated with the model data and its respective mesh data.

Parameters:
Model* model
Returns:
void
